physical_examinations.relevant_findings: Recipient twin had a right mastectomy in 1998 for stage II breast cancer. The twin sisters were confirmed to be monozygotic twins through DNA testing.
Recipient twin had a history of invasive carcinoma of the left breast treated with mastectomy in November of 2000 followed by postoperative chemotherapy.
physical_examinations.changes_over_time: By postoperative day 5, the distal inferior lateral aspect of the flap showed signs of ischemia leading to debridement of 183 g of the flap.

physical_examinations.relevant_findings: Recipient had a history of stage III ductal carcinoma of the left breast treated with modified radical mastectomy, with later surgery resulting in a symptomatic capsular contracture.
physical_examinations.changes_over_time: Three months after transplants, the recipient twin required bilateral nipple reconstruction and left breast flap revisions due to skin contracture.
